meanings.definition: Used as an emphatic form of 'himself'.
meanings.sent1: Tommy wanted to prove hisself by climbing the tree all on his own.
meanings.sent2: He always does his homework by hisself without any help.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Billy jokingly challenged hisself to eat ten hot dogs in a minute.
meanings.sent4: In the mirror maze, Sarah felt lost and confused, as if she was searching for hisself.
meanings.sent5: The superhero bravely faced the villain by hisself, ready for any challenge.

meanings.definition: Used informally in some dialects to mean 'himself'.
meanings.sent1: Sheila's little brother insists on tying his shoes all by hisself.
meanings.sent2: Grandpa likes to fix things around the house by hisself.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to think hisself the king of the house, lounging on the sofa.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood tall and proud, as if it had a life of hisself.
meanings.sent5: The explorer ventured into the jungle by hisself, eager to discover new creatures.
